title: Nutrient dense superfoods that improve overall health
summary: These superfoods are packed with vitamins and minerals, antioxidants, and other nutrients that help your body fight off diseases. Eating these foods can help you maintain a healthy, balanced diet while staying within your daily calorie limit. Superfoods can be eaten raw, cooked, or added to smoothies or eaten as a quick snack. Goji berries are a great source of antioxidants, amino acids, and iron. Hemp seeds have been around for hundreds of years, but only in the past decade have they become a more popular superfood.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Superfoods are nutrient-dense foods that have a high concentration of disease-fighting vitamins and minerals. They also tend to be high in antioxidants, fiber, and other phytonutrients that help protect your body from free radicals and diseases. These healthy, natural foods can be found in almost any corner of the globe. Many indigenous cultures eat these as staples because of their abundant benefits for the human body.
Superfoods generally have impressive quantities of some or many nutrients, such as carotenoids (vitamin A), flavonoids, vitamins C and E, or omega-3 fatty acids (ALA). There are many types of superfoods; here is a list of 20 worth adding to your diet:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Chia Seeds"),mdx("p",null,"Chia seeds have gained a lot of popularity over the last few years, and it\u2019s easy to see why. They make a great superfood because they are packed with fiber and protein. They are also one of the richest sources of essential minerals such as calcium, iron, and magnesium. Chia seeds can also be a great source of antioxidants, making them great for overall health."),mdx("p",null,"Chia seeds can be eaten either raw or dried. When eaten raw, they are best added to smoothies or salads. Dried chia seeds can be used in baking."),mdx("h2",null,"Goji Berries"),mdx("p",null,"Goji berries have been a staple of Asian cultures for thousands of years. They are now becoming more popular in the West, and for good reason. Goji berries are a great source of antioxidants, amino acids, and iron. They are also known to promote better eye health as they are a great source of beta-carotene."),mdx("p",null,"Goji berries can be eaten raw or dried. They can be added to salads, trail mixes, yogurts, or just eaten as a quick snack."),mdx("h2",null,"Hemp Seeds"),mdx("p",null,"Hemp seeds have been around for hundreds of years, but only in the past decade have they become a more popular superfood. Hemp seeds are a great source of protein and essential fatty acids. They are also rich in minerals such as iron, magnesium, and zinc. Hemp seeds also contain a host of vitamins, including vitamin E and most B vitamins."),mdx("p",null,"Hemp seeds can be eaten raw or roasted. They can be added to salads, smoothies, cereals, or just eaten as a quick snack. Hemp seeds are also great in baking, particularly muffins or cookies."),mdx("h2",null,"Blueberries"),mdx("p",null,"Blueberries have been a superfood for decades. They are a great source of antioxidants and vitamins. Blueberries are particularly high in vitamin C and they are also a great source of fiber. Blueberries have also been shown to help reduce the risk of heart disease, cancer, and diabetes."),mdx("p",null,"Blueberries can be eaten raw or dried. They can be added to salads, yogurts, or just eaten as a quick snack. Blueberries are also great in baked goods."),mdx("h2",null,"Sardines"),mdx("p",null,"Sardines are a staple of many diets, particularly those of Mediterranean cultures. They are a great source of protein as well as essential vitamins and minerals. Sardines are also an excellent source of omega-3 fatty acids. These fatty acids are important for many bodily functions, including brain health and reducing inflammation."),mdx("p",null,"Sardines can be eaten either raw or cooked. They can be added to salads or eaten as a quick snack. Sardines are also great in sandwiches, particularly on a bagel or on rye bread."),mdx("h2",null,"Kale"),mdx("p",null,"Kale has become a very popular superfood in the last decade. It has been shown to help prevent cancer, improve heart health, reduce inflammation, and keep the body's systems healthy and balanced. Kale is a great source of vitamins and minerals. Kale also has plenty of antioxidants which help combat free radicals and can help prevent disease."),mdx("p",null,"Kale can be eaten raw or cooked. It is great in salads, soups, or just eaten as a quick snack. Kale can also be added to smoothies."),mdx("h2",null,"Acai Berries"),mdx("p",null,"Acai berries have only recently become a superfood, but they have quickly become one of the most popular. Acai berries are a great source of antioxidants and vitamins. They also contain plenty of amino acids, particularly essential amino acids. Acai berries are also a good source of fiber and are known to help prevent disease and promote better digestive health."),mdx("p",null,"Acai berries can be eaten raw or dried, but they are best when powdered. They can be added to smoothies or just eaten as a quick snack. Acai berries can also be mixed with yogurt."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"There are many benefits that can be gained from eating superfoods. They are packed with vitamins and minerals, antioxidants, and other nutrients that help your body fight off diseases, such as cancer and heart disease. Eating these foods can help you maintain a healthy, balanced diet while staying within your daily calorie limit. Superfoods are great for nutrition, taste, and are often very affordable. They are worth adding to your diet and can be eaten in so many different ways."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Unexpected Benefits of a Plant Based Diet
One-Dish Meals - Recipes for Busy Weeknights

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s almost a clich\xE9 at this point, but so many of us are busy these days. It seems like everyone is rushing from one activity to another and then logging long hours at work or school. As a result, we crave fast food and takeout more than ever before.
Thankfully, home-cooked meals are coming back in vogue again. People want to know where their food comes from and how it\u2019s prepared. There\u2019s also an emphasis on reducing stress levels by creating more time in our days with fewer obligations outside the home.
In short, people are becoming more aware of their health and making changes accordingly \u2013 great news for families everywhere!
One-dest meals are an excellent way to get back to basics and prepare wholesome home-cooked meals that don\u2019t take long to make or leave you with lots of dirty dishes afterwards. Read on for some great tips on how you can make one-dish chicken recipes part of your weekly routine once again\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 6 Ways to Make Your Diet More Nutritious

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Do you feel like your diet just isn\u2019t cutting it? Maybe it\u2019s time to amp things up a notch. A good diet is essential to a healthy life, and with so many different diets being promoted these days, it can be hard to separate fact from fiction. When it comes to nutrition, there are so many factors to take into account. You might know that vitamins and minerals are important and that fats, proteins, and carbs all play an important role in your diet. But how do you actually make sure that your diet reflects those principles? Here are some tips and tricks on how you can make your diet more nutritious:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make the Perfect Grilled Cheese Sandwich

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Grilled cheese is one of the most comforting and delicious sandwiches you can eat. It's universally loved, and for good reason: It's warm, gooey, and perfect for chilly days or after school snacks.
This grilled cheese also happens to be the best grilled cheese sandwich you'll ever have. With a few simple tips, you can take this classic sandwich from bland to brilliant in just a few steps.
We all know that grilled cheese can be made in different ways with different ingredients. But there is more than one way to prepare it so that it's not soggy or too dry or burnt on the outside but not quite melted enough on the inside.
With these tips and tricks, your next grilled cheese will be perfect!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are Fermented Foods & Why You Should Start Eating Them

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Fermented foods are having a moment. Everywhere you look, you see another article about the benefits of these slightly strange-sounding foods and the gut bacteria they feed. They\u2019re the new kale, you might say. And we wouldn\u2019t blame you if you thought it was all a little bit weird and gross at first. After all, let\u2019s face it: Fermented foods are rather bizarre when you think about them for long enough! But as with most things, looks can be deceiving. It turns out that fermented foods are actually incredibly good for us \u2013 so much so that nutritionists have been recommending them as part of a healthy diet for years now. In this article, we\u2019ll take a look at what exactly fermented foods are, why they\u2019re so good for us and how to incorporate them into your diet."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Is Organic Really Worth the Extra Cost?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You can\u2019t open a magazine or social media feed these days without seeing something about the organic food movement. In fact, the organic food market is growing faster than any other segment of the food industry. According to the Organic Trade Association, sales of organic foods increased by almost 10% in 2017 alone. And given that more and more consumers are becoming aware of what they\u2019re eating and where it comes from, that isn\u2019t going to change anytime soon. Which begs the question: Are all those new organic options worth it? Do they really taste better than conventional alternatives? Are they healthier for you? And most importantly, is the cost worth it?
If you read through all the information on different types of organic foods and their benefits, you might be feeling a little overwhelmed right now. That\u2019s totally normal! But don\u2019t fret\u2014we have you covered with everything you need to know about whether or not organic is worth its hefty price tag.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Feeding a Family on a Budget - Tips and Recipes

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re on a budget, eating healthy can feel like an impossible task. Conventional wisdom says that eating well is expensive and that eating poorly is cheap. But this isn\u2019t always the case. You can eat well even if you have a small food budget, as long as you plan ahead and know where to look for bargains. Healthy eating doesn\u2019t have to be expensive; it just might not be cheap. "),mdx("p",null,"With careful planning and smart shopping, however, it needn\u2019t break the bank. Eating well on a budget isn\u2019t about cutting out all the things you love or pretending that you live in famine conditions; it\u2019s about knowing how to save money while accessing healthy food that gives you energy and happiness in your life. Check out these tips and recipes so that eating healthy on a budget becomes easier than ever before!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
